channel.title: RAM question
channel.description:
Well, I want some more RAM, but I dont know if I can just go and buy some and add them in. Currently I only have 512mb, and I want atleast 1gb or 1.5gb. I found 2 in a shop near my place:
Kingston KVR400D2N3/1G - 1024MB PC2-3200 400MHz DDR2 CL3 DIMM € 23,50 Kingston KVR400D2N3K2/1G - 1024MB PC2-3200 400MHz DDR2 CL3 DIMM (Kit of 2x512MB) € 27,00
The two images below are from CPU-Z, one from the memory tab and one from the SPD tab. Now my question is, are those two RAM kits possible (one of the two) or not?
Thanks in advance.

item.title: RAM question
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

It’s about a year or two old. I have upgraded it a bit, put a new HDD in it and a new gfx card. But S!ms already helped me, thanks again for that.

The next PC will be self built, I’ve had enough of these crappy over priced PC’s. I’ve been working in a computer shop for a while, so I know how to build one now. The thing is that I don’t know what parts are compatible with eachother.

Anyways, this thread can be locked, I have my answer.

Read full topic

item.title: RAM question
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

How old is this computer?

And the thing with pre-built PC’s is that they are almost never easily upgradable. Most of them come with MicroATX mobo’s, which are crap if you want to upgrade regularly.

Read full topic

item.title: RAM question
item.dc:creator: @S_ms S!ms
item.description:
@S_ms wrote:

Look, DDR and DDR2 are whole different technologies. You can’t put DDR2 sticks on a DDR Mobo, just as you can’t use an AGP videocard on a PCIe mobo

Read full topic

item.title: RAM question
item.dc:creator: @Hiaburi Hiaburi
item.description:
@Hiaburi wrote:

Pretty sure that its the mobo, don’t think you can do from ddr2 to ddr or vise versa…

Read full topic

item.title: RAM question
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

Yea I have 2 slots, so buying the kit of 2 512 mb ones isn’t the smartest thing to do :P. Maby a stupid question, but is the DDR stuff bound to the Mobo or the RAM sticks?

Read full topic

item.title: RAM question
item.dc:creator: @S_ms S!ms
item.description:
@S_ms wrote:

Don’t buy, you have DDR, those are DDR2.

Read full topic

item.title: RAM question
item.dc:creator: @Epic_One Epic One
item.description:
@Epic_One wrote:

Yup, You can buy 2 Ram sticks, By what it shows I cant tell if you have 2 or 4 Ram slots, But either way, if you have 2, you can remove the 512 and replace it with a 1024M Ram stick.

But those ram modules will work. Btw good choice in Kingston.

Read full topic

item.title: RAM question
item.dc:creator: @Thebeanie TheBeanie
item.description:
@Thebeanie wrote:

Find out what type of ram your computer has, then open it up and find out how many spare slots you have… And btw Kingston are good but get ram with more MHz Say 1gb 667MHz

Read full topic
